text: The Temple of Athena Nike is a temple on the Acropolis of Athens. It was named after the Greek goddess, Athena Nike. The temple was built around 420BC. It is the earliest fully Ionic temple on the Acropolis. The temple measured only in width and in length. The temple has four columns on the bothe the front and back sides. ==References== Category:Ancient Greek and Roman temples and shrines Category:5th-century BC buildings and structures Category:Acropolis of Athens
title: Temple of Athena Nike
